name: Urbanization Endangers Monarchs
description:
The image, "Urbanization Endangers Monarchs" is one of twenty images created for a special AI Art Series, “Save Monarch Butterflies". The concept of the series is to increase awareness to the disturbing status as well as the amazing migration of Monarch Butterflies. The Monarch Butterfly is one of North America’s most phenomenal species. As the only butterfly known to make the transcontinental migration, Monarch Butterflies will be migrating from September to October in order to arrive at their "wintering" sites in November. Monarch Butterflies encounter various challenges on their two-way journey… strong winds can blow them off course... rain and/or cold temperatures can slow them down... the lack of energy-producing nectar sources, and parasitic diseases can lead to death as well as collisions with humans and their vehicles.

The image was created with the assistance of artificial intelligence (AI). The process for creating this image included using a text prompt, algorithms, and artificial intelligence. The Snowpixel App was used in the process of creating this image. Each image may be interpreted differently through the eyes and imagination of the viewers.
